titleStmt.title: Letter from H. M. Schieffelin to Hamilton Fish, May 11, 1870

bibl.title: Letter from H. M. Schieffelin to Hamilton Fish
Notes from Liberian Legation In U.S. to Department of State, 1862-1898 T807

div1.p:
Legation of Liberia
Yonkers, N.Y. May 11, 1870

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your note of the 19th ult, enclosing a communication from the Secretary of the Navy, stating that a copy of my letter, in reference to the apprehension of an attack of the natives on the settlements of Liberia, will be forwarded to Rear Admiral Radford commanding the European fleet, for which, please receive thanks.

The telegram, that Liberia was engaged in war with the natives proves untrue, letters dated there later, make
Honble Hamilton Fish
Secretary of State
Washington D.C.
no mention of it. On the contrary, a letter from President Roye states, that they are about extending a road into the interior for commerce &c.
I regret the trouble occasioned by this false report.

I have the honor to be with the highest consideration
Sir
Your obedient servant
H. M. Schieffelin
